channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Block 153 Granville Road, NW6, 5th January
item.description:
Outside the block Shoes Dumped on the floor. And Bins PACKED with Household and other Rubbish OVER FLOWING. It looks TERRIBLE. ALL NEEDS CLEARING ASAP.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Missing hold cover, outside Regents court entrance, 5th January
item.description:
Missing hole cover means there is a hole in the ground and a potential tripping hazard. A cone has been used as temporary fix but hold cover needs replacing as it has been over 3 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Lane, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Alder Road, 5th January
item.description:
Car parked both sides of the road. Blocking the road. No cars or emergency services can go down the road passed a point. The happens several times a week. Please can we have some car parking bays and some yellow lines. To stop the road being blocked every week by different cars.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alder Road, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Starbucks, 5th January
item.description:
This bike has been attached to this lamppost of over a year. Obviously abandoned. The back wheel is damaged and bucked and it’s a health and safety problem for anyone wanting to enter a Black Taxi. It is chained to the lampost of a taxi rank and sometimes falls to the ground and then is in the road. It needs removing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Thames Street, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken/damaged railings, 5th January
item.description:
This an urgent health and safety concern regarding the broken and damaged railings outside Thomas Tallis School on Kidbrooke Park Road. Kidbrooke Park Road is a very busy main road, and Thomas Tallis School is a large secondary school with over 2100 students. The damaged railings present a significant safety risk to students, staff, and members of the public, particularly during peak arrival and departure times. Given the potential risk of serious harm, I would be grateful if this issue could be assessed and repaired as a matter of urgency.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kidbrooke Park Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pothole in middle lane, 5th January
item.description:
